Summary: The 3 West Club is associated with the Republican National Women's Club and has hosted young debutantes. The hotel's location is near Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral, and Radio City Music Hall.

The hotel is located near Restaurant Row and Times Square, with many restaurants and bars in the area, and offers a small continental breakfast. Guests have noted that the lobby doubles as a breakfast room, which encourages conviviality, and that the hotel attracts many European guests.

60 Thompson has a lively atmosphere with a hip lobby bar that is popular with local trendsetters and celebrities. The hotel has a rooftop bar open late into the night with city views, but it can be closed for private events.

6 Columbus has a lively atmosphere with a popular sushi restaurant and bar that is vibrant at night, as well as hip and trendy decor with music playing in the lobby. The hotel is a popular spot to start and end a night out in NYC, and many reviewers enjoy its central location near restaurants and bars.

The hotel has a bar/restaurant, a wine reception in the lobby every evening, and happy hour from 5-7 pm. Some guests mentioned live music in the lounge but didn't hear it as it didn't start at the time it was advertised to.

The Ace Hotel has a friendly hipster vibe with a beautiful lobby and bar that becomes a lively scene at night, especially on weekends. The hotel lobby is a fun place to hang out and have a drink, with DJs during CMJ music confab, and the rooms are sound-proofed against the lobby noise.
This hotel has a lounge that offers complimentary wine and cheese on weekday nights and is frequented by tourists. There is also a nightclub right next to the hotel.

The bar area was dark and dismal, but was seen as a neighborhood bar with a mix of hotel guests and locals. There was also a nightclub downstairs that caused noise at all hours.
The Smyth Tribeca has a trendy lobby/bar area with cozy nooks. The crowd at the property seemed really young & hip with a handsome group of people all over.
This hotel has a bar and a restaurant with free computers with internet access in the lobby. The bar is a great place to have drinks and the hotel atmosphere was described as very French.

The Soho Grand Hotel has a lively lobby bar and lounge area with a trendy or hip atmosphere, often featuring DJs and attracting a cool crowd. However, some reviewers noted noise from the bar could be disturbing in lower-floor rooms.

Soho House New York is a trendy hotel with a rooftop pool and bar that is popular with club members. The hotel has a lively bar scene and is located in the Meatpacking District, which is known for its nightlife.

The Stay Hotel has a lively atmosphere, with the Aspen Social Club bar/restaurant downstairs turning into a nightclub until 4 AM on weekends; some guests have noted noise issues on lower floors. The bar is popular, with a lodge-like theme and music.
The Alex Hotel is next to an authentic Irish pub that shares the hotel wall and a good bar called Perfect Pint is right next door. Riingo restaurant also has a lively bar.
I'm sorry, but there is not enough information about "lively atmosphere" to provide a summary.

Some guests mention that the bar buzzes and has great cocktails and that they enjoyed a cocktail in the Emery Bar off the lobby one night; other guests mention the lack of nightlife and that the hotel bar closed early. The hotel is near bars and restaurants located on 2nd Ave.
Based on the reviews, the Blakely Hotel is known for being quiet and comfortable. Some reviewers noted a lively atmosphere nearby but not at the hotel itself.

The Bowery Hotel has a lively atmosphere with a popular lobby bar that attracts locals and becomes an extension of the bar in the evenings; it can get crowded, especially on weekends. The hotel restaurant, Gemma, is also popular and has a buzzy ambiance.

The Bryant Park Hotel has a lively atmosphere, with a popular bar/club in the basement that attracts a young, trendy crowd. It's been described as buzzing with activity and is known as a fashion/celeb hot spot.

Here's a summary of the Carlton Hotel, based on the reviews, focusing on its atmosphere:

The hotel lobby is grand and atmospheric but often described as creepily quiet, and the bar sometimes closes early if not busy. Reviews suggest a more lively atmosphere can be found outside the hotel, in nearby bars or at Robert DeNiro's Tribeca Grill.

The Carlyle has a lively atmosphere in its bars, with Judy Collins and Woody Allen's Jazz band playing, and a supper club called Cafe Carlyle. Bemelman's Bar is also a popular spot with live jazz music.
I am sorry, but there is not enough information about the hotel's atmosphere to respond to the query.
The French Quarters Guest Apartments is located above a bar, Bourbon Street, and is connected to local bars in Times Square. The hotel has a lively atmosphere, with a pub that is hopping each night.
This hotel has a modern and clean design with a boutique feel, but without a restaurant or cool bar scene. It is located in Chelsea with many restaurants and bars nearby.
I am sorry, but the reviews for this hotel do not mention a lively atmosphere. Most reviewers mention that the hotel is quiet.

The Gem Hotel is located in a lively part of town near the East Village, Little Italy, and Chinatown, with many clubs, restaurants, and shops nearby. Some rooms can be noisy due to the hotel's location on Houston Street.
I am sorry, but the reviews do not describe the Grant Hotel as having a lively atmosphere.

This Hampton Inn is described as very busy, catering to families and tourists, with events such as school trips frequently booking. Reviews mention a crowded breakfast room, particularly during peak hours.
This hotel has spacious rooms with kitchenettes and sitting areas, some newly refurbished. It is located one block from Central Park and close to subways, restaurants, and shopping on Madison Avenue.
This hotel is in a great location across from Central Park and close to a subway station. Harry's Bar is located in the hotel.
This hotel does not have a lively atmosphere, but is near Times Square, Penn Station, Broadway, and Macy's. Some guests mentioned noise from the street, air conditioning, and construction.
Hotel 91 is located in the heart of Manhattan's Chinatown, a busy area with street vendors and markets. The Golden Unicorn dim sum restaurant is nearby, featuring a "wild aggressive loud atmosphere."

I am sorry, I cannot provide information about hotels with lively atmospheres. However, the Hotel at Times Square is in a great location near Times Square/theatre district and many restaurants and bars. There is also a small bar in the hotel.

The Inn at Irving Place has a bar in the basement with an outdoor patio; there can be noise from the bar and parties in the Inn. One reviewer mentioned garage music from the adjoining club and kids hanging out in front of the bar until 3 am.

There is a small bar in the restaurant, but some guests found the lobby and other common areas lacked a lively atmosphere and closed early. The location is near Times Square, but far enough away to be a "quiet treasure".
The Jane Hotel has a popular club accessed through the lobby, with lines of people outside at night. The hotel also has a bar and lounge area that often hosts parties with live bands.
The Kimberly Hotel has a lobby with lots of action and is located on a street with lots of action. The hotel is next to Nikki's restaurant, which serves a Sunday buffet brunch.
The Lombardy is located in Midtown Manhattan near shopping, restaurants, and Central Park. The hotel has a bar and is next door to the Table xII restaurant.

The London NYC has a lively restaurant and bar scene that attracts a certain standard of clientele and is open until 1 am, making it a place where one feels they have truly arrived. Reviews note the bar was a buzz of activity, was hopping in the evening, and has a good, trendy vibe.

The Lucerne is near many restaurants and bars on Amsterdam Avenue, including the Amsterdam Inn, which is described as lively. Some reviewers mention noise from traffic and bar patrons on Amsterdam and 79th, though higher floors are reportedly quieter.
The Manhattan Club is in a great location with energy of New York City and is close to Times Square. There is a 26th floor lounge that includes a bar that is open to members and hotel guests.

The Mansfield Hotel has a cocktail bar/restaurant with a relaxing yet sophisticated literary leather and cigar vibe. The bar in the lobby area has live jazz and good, but overpriced, cocktails, with a nice after dinner drinks spot.

The Marcel is next to Inoteca, a lively neighborhood bar/restaurant, and close to many fun bars, with Molly's Irish pub down the street. The restaurant downstairs has a New York neighborhood feel and a great cocktail bar.

The Maritime Hotel has a lively atmosphere, with a happening bar and outdoor spaces that become "party central" in the spring and fall. The hotel also has a downstairs club that is very hip with a good DJ.

The Mark's bar area is small, and the hotel is frequented by actors; it is located on the Upper East Side near museums, art galleries, Central Park, and upscale shopping. The hotel was recently renovated in 2009, and the rooms are modern in design.
This hotel is located on the Upper East Side, in a residential area, and is a few blocks from the subway. The reviews mention subway construction outside, which can cause noise.

The hotel has vibrant red colors and balloons in the lobby, with decor that is chic, stylish and vibrant. The lobby decor and music had a disco feeling with shiny red walls and glitzy glass light fixtures.
The Mercer has a lively atmosphere in its lobby and is known for attracting celebrities, making it a good spot for people-watching. The Mercer Kitchen restaurant in the basement is also very lively.

The Michelangelo Hotel is in a prime location close to Times Square and Broadway theaters. The hotel has a piano bar with live music and some reviewers describe the surrounding area as noisy and vibrant.
I am sorry, but the hotel reviews focus on the Milburn's location and value and do not discuss its atmosphere. Therefore, I cannot recommend it based on a lively atmosphere.
The Muse Hotel has a lively bar and is located near Times Square. The bar isn't very well lit in the evenings and there is often music around the hotel.
The Helmsley has a small but pleasant bar and lobby with bartenders who have stories. The lobby is busy with activity and the staff is helpful.
The New Yorker Hotel has a bustling lobby with activity day and night, and a 24-hour diner, the Tick Tock Diner, attached. Coopers Tavern, the hotel bar, has a pleasant and nice atmosphere.

The Pierre's lobby bar and restaurant, Caprice, appear to be popular spots that are busy well into the evening. The lobby lounge also has a cocktail menu that is surprisingly reasonably priced and has become a hit with many.
The hotel has a lively bar that is great for people watching, and also includes a champagne bar in the lobby. The Rose Club is a new venue that attracts a younger crowd.

The Pod Hotel is noted for its funky and hip atmosphere, with music playing in the hallways and bathrooms, and a roof terrace where guests socialize; Le Bateau Ivre is a French bar next door. However, some guests noted the potential for noise due to thin walls.
The Premier is located half a block from Times Square, close to the theater district. Some rooms offer views of the Chrysler Building and Times Square.

The hotel has a lobby bar that many reviewers enjoyed, some describing it as one of the best in NY, with a lively atmosphere, and good for people-watching. One reviewer mentioned that the Star Lounge has obscene prices, but the service and atmosphere are worth it.
The Roosevelt Hotel has a bar off the lobby that is busy and lively, with a rooftop bar, Mad46, described as a hipster joint. Some found the bar expensive but with a nice atmosphere.

I'm sorry, but based on the reviews, The Sherry-Netherland offers a quiet, intimate atmosphere, which does not align with the query for a lively atmosphere. The hotel is described as a tranquil hideout from the city, with personalized service due to its smaller size and residential feel.
The Shoreham is a trendy, modern, and hip boutique hotel with a lively bar, though it can get noisy. The hotel is known for playing hip music.

The King Cole Bar is a popular spot known for inventing the Bloody Mary and features a famous mural, though it can get crowded. The hotel also has lounges in small rooms off the lobby with intimate seating arrangements.

The Standard Hotel has a lively bar scene downstairs and an 18th-floor lounge/club; it is located in the Meatpacking District with many nearby restaurants, bars, and clubs. Some reviewers mention noise from nearby bars that play music until the early morning.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention whether The Surrey has a lively atmosphere. They do praise the hotel for its elegance and location close to Central Park.

The Sylvan Guest House is located in Harlem, near a grocery store and multiple subway lines, including an express train to Manhattan. The house features African art decorations, a well-equipped kitchen, and a terrace.

The Time Hotel has a trendy bar/lounge that is a happening spot, with some reviews noting it gets very crowded and noisy, especially on weekends and Friday nights, with music lasting until late. Some guests have noted noise from the bar can be heard in lower-floor rooms.
The Waldorf Astoria has a beautiful lobby with a lively atmosphere, especially when state visits or events occur. Harry's Bar, off the lobby, features Frank Sinatra tunes and a lively bar scene.

Multiple reviews mention a lively, central Times Square location and a lobby bar. Some reviews mention that the hotel is connected to a movie theater and within close proximity to many Broadway shows.

The hotel has a bar/restaurant, Zana's, attached and the Crooked Knife bar is across the road, though reviewers note that the best nightlife bars are a 15-20 minute walk away. Many reviewers enjoyed the lively atmosphere of the Crooked Knife, mentioning that it is frequented by locals and offers good food and drink.

The hotel has a lively bar scene, especially when the outside bar is open, and is located in the Lower East Side, which offers many bars and restaurants. Some guests noted noise from the 7th-floor bar.
I am sorry, but the hotel reviews do not contain information about the hotel's atmosphere. They mostly focus on value, location, cleanliness, and some mentions of noise.

The Tribeca Grand has a trendy bar/lounge (Church Lounge) that is a popular hot spot, with DJs and parties on weekends, but can be noisy due to the hotel's atrium design. The bar is open late and attracts a young, fashionable crowd, and sometimes hosts private events.

I am sorry, but the reviews do not have information about the hotel having a lively atmosphere. Many reviews do note the location of the hotel as being across the street from Central Park, with a subway station on the corner, and the Time Warner Center just across Broadway.

*   There is a bar in the hotel.
*   McFadden's, an Irish bar, is located across the street from the hotel.

I am sorry, but there is no mention of a lively atmosphere for this hotel. However, there is mention of a bar being open from 5 PM to 11 PM in the hotel. The hotel is located near many restaurants, delis and shopping locations in a good location.
The W The Court has a lively bar scene that attracts a younger crowd, and the music from the bar can be heard in the lobby and elevators. The hotel is also located near many restaurants and bars.
The W Court is next door and shares amenities, its bar is bustling and fun. The Wet Bar on the ground floor of the hotel is a hopping place.
This trendy hotel is known for its lively atmosphere, lobby bar, and downstairs club. The bar can get crowded and noisy, attracting a younger crowd.

The W Union Square is known for its lively lobby scene with a popular bar, often crowded with a trendy clientele, and a basement nightclub called Underbar. Some reviewers found the lobby bar a great place to relax and people-watch, while others mentioned the bar scene could be noisy and the music loud, which sometimes affected the rooms.

The Waldorf Astoria is known for its grand lobby and public areas that are always buzzing with activity, in contrast to the quieter, more private Towers. Some reviewers mention dining at the Bull and Bear restaurant, known for its lively atmosphere.

The Wall Street Inn is located in the Financial District, which is noted as being quiet, especially on weekends. Some reviewers mentioned a lively atmosphere on Stone Street behind the hotel, which has many restaurants.
The Warwick Hotel has a lively bar called Randolph's, which has a comfortable atmosphere and serves light food and drinks. There are several restaurants and bars in close proximity to the hotel.

The Washington Jefferson Hotel is located near Times Square and Broadway, with a bar next door and close proximity to many restaurants; it is also located on a street with outdoor bistro seating. Some reviewers mention noise from garbage trucks, street traffic, and bar patrons at night.
The hotel is located near Washington Square Park, which often has musicians and other entertainment. It is also located in Greenwich Village, near bars and restaurants with a lively nightlife.

The Wellington Hotel has a lively atmosphere, with the lobby often bustling with people; the hotel bar is located in the Molyvos restaurant, known for great drinks. Some recent guests commented on the area around the hotel being busy both day and night.
The hotel has an owner's lounge with continental breakfast and evening hors d'oeuvres, and a 25th-floor outdoor terrace. The location is central, close to attractions, restaurants, and subway lines.

The hotel sometimes hosts Halloween parties and has a bar downstairs that can be noisy with music until late at night. Some guests have complained about noise from garbage trucks and construction at night, even on high floors, though the hotel provides earplugs and white noise machines.

The Wolcott Hotel is described as old-fashioned and historic, with potential for noise due to thin walls, door slamming and old heating system, it's also known to host large youth groups. While lacking a restaurant, it is centrally located near attractions and dining options.

This is an apartment-style accommodation, not a full-service hotel, located on the Upper West Side near the 72nd street subway station with access to local shops and restaurants. Reviews mention noise from garbage trucks and neighbors.
The hotel has a bar and a 10th-floor terrace bar with drinks. There is a small restaurant/bar with a TV and full menu.
